column2: MARYLAND DMV TEST
Question Text
1. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 3. Large trucks:
column4: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 4. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 5. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
6. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
7. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 8. Before you change lanes, you should:
column6: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column8: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
10. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
11. A red traffic sign means?
12. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 13. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
14. The picture shows a _________ sign.
15. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 16. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column4: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 20. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column6: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 21. This sign indicates:
22. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 24. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 25. Arrows on the roadway:
column8: show which lanes you must use.
